name: Squats on Multipress
how_to_perform:
1. Stand in front of a multipress machine, with the handle at shoulder height.
2. Grip the handle firmly with both hands and place your feet slightly narrower than shoulder width apart.
3. Hold the handle and engage your core by drawing your belly button towards your spine.
4. Bend your knees as if you were going to sit down, keeping your back straight and your weight evenly distributed between both legs.
5. Lower yourself down until your thighs are parallel to the ground, maintaining a controlled pace throughout the movement.
6. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement, ensuring that your posture remains correct.
7. Push through your heels to return to the starting position, extending your legs fully as you lift.
8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: Squats on Multipress is a machine-based upper body exercise that primarily works the quads and glutes, targeting muscle groups in the lower body.
